content.intro: M7: Data In Sustainable Energy | Chapter 3

content.text: This chapter explores the application of data science techniques and energy modelling tools to drive data-driven insights in the energy sector. It emphasizes the role of Exploratory Data Analysis in uncovering patterns, identifying anomalies, and validating data for further analysis, with a focus on leveraging AI to automate processes like data cleaning, clustering, and anomaly detection. The module also highlights the integration of remote sensing and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) for spatial analysis, enabling precise monitoring of environmental changes and optimization of renewable energy resources. Energy modelling is presented as a critical tool for policy analysis, system planning, and scenario evaluation, supporting decision-making in areas such as renewable energy integration, load forecasting, and grid stability. Case studies, including poverty mapping in the Philippines and clean energy transition planning in Tanzania, illustrate the practical application of these tools in real-world contexts. The module underscores the importance of high-quality data and robust data management practices in enhancing the accuracy and reliability of energy models.
